thread.title: Jeremy Vine 'road rage' driver found guilty of road rage
thread.title_full: Jeremy Vine 'road rage' driver found guilty of road rage

title: Jeremy Vine 'road rage' driver found guilty of road rage
text:
Jeremy Vine 'road rage' driver found guilty of road rage 1 February 2017 Image copyright PA Image caption Shanique Syrena Pearson denies using threatening, abusive or insulting words or behaviour A driver filmed screaming obscenities at BBC presenter Jeremy Vine as he cycled on a narrow road has been found guilty of road rage offences. 
Shanique Syrena Pearson, 22, made a gun sign and threatened Mr Vine during the row in Kensington, west London. 
She was convicted of using threatening, abusive or insulting words or behaviour. 
Pearson was also found guilty of driving without reasonable consideration for other road users. Image caption Shanique Syrena Pearson "made a gun sign" at BBC presenter Jeremy Vine during the road rage incident, the court heard
